author: pipermerriam
content: How do you establish a stable distribution of data over time.  Nodes come online today and pick a random seciton of history to store.  When new sections from the head of the chain move out of everyone's storage you need them to be stored in this random distributed model, but all of the online nodes already picked some random subsection of the history when they came online....

author: pipermerriam

Maybe the meta point that I want to make here is that when you solve for all of these problems, the shape of the solution is likely to be....  Portal...  My impression of your tweet is that it casts portal as un-necessarily complex.  It sort of says: "look at how easy it is to solve this problem", and on the surface it seems like a nice solution... but when you dig into the problem there are lots of hidden problems that aren't solved.
